reviews.review_msg: Vincent was SO welcoming to his students. He was always available if you had questions and was really helpful when you got confused or stuck. Honestly, probably the best prof i've had at SFU. He made the material so engaging and interesting that I rarely found myself zoning out.

Best prof I've ever had. He is engaging, passionate and knowledgable, and most importantly he draws upon real and relevant examples to communicate the course concepts. He is always open for discussion and welcomes the opportunity to meet with you to walk you through course material or assignments. He makes you want to do well in this class.

I've never enjoyed a long lecture as much as I do in Vincent's class. He makes everything highly accessible while always bringing it back to the subject matter and challenging us as the intellectuals we are. I feel supported and respected when I speak in class, and he is highly accessible for office hours and providing feedback. 10/10 best prof.

Such a great prof! He's incredibly kind and goes out of his way to know peoples names. It's a 3-hour lecture, which could get boring really easily, but it never did in his class. He does a really good job of making the course material engaging and relevant and encourages in class discussion.

Vincent is my favorite prof in cmns. He combines theory and real world well to help the material make sense. I learned a lot from his lecture. He's nice and very patient. He is always there to help out. If you get stuck or confused anytime, just talk with him. The final exam is the hardest part of the class. You really need to work on notes he gave

As a new CMNS transfer student, he's hands down the best lecturer I've encountered at SFU. He's passionate, and the way in which he speaks keeps you engaged the entire lecture. I never lose focus or zone out  (which for me is pretty unusual). Vince is extremely kind and knows his stuff. Content is SO much more interesting than I thought

Vincent is the best!!! His lecture is awesome that makes sense about what's going on in resding. Go through concept with clear definition and organized material so well that it's easy to follow. Always there for help with patience. Definitely recommend!!!
Vincent was super passionate about his subject, and this translated into really engaging lectures. An accessible and knowledgeable guy, and a fair marker.

Brilliant guy. He managed to discuss politics, economy and social justice through the framework of popular culture- a topic that all 20-something students can relate to. I have immense respect for his talent to engage students and deliver his teachings with such passion and would love to see him on TED Talks. I also might have a crush on him.

Vincent was absolutely fantastic as a prof. His 4 hour lectures were clear, interesting, and easy to sit through. He was very interested and knowledgable in his field and this really came across in the way he speaks. On top of all of this, he was just a genuinely nice guy and really gave the impression of caring about his students. Would take again

Vincent is an amazing professor! Not only is he easy on the eyes, he is engaging and genuinely interested in the course topics. Most importantly, I can actually sit through his 4 hour lectures without getting distracted or bored. I would definitely take a course with him again!
one of the best profs I've ever had...he's here for the students
really nice. pretty helpful. Also kinda sexy
Stacey is an awesome professor! Looking forward to take other classes with her.

I learned from Scott while he was a TA, during then there was quite the buzz of him being difficult. unluckily (or luckily) I didn't hear about this until the semester started. He's difficult but he's helpful if you visit his office hours and actually do what you're supposed to do. READ! He's clear on what he wants and is actually very reasonable .

I enjoyed taking this class with Dr. Murphy as he is very understanding and tries to make online learning fun. Aside from being a nice guy, there are some issues with the course. His grading rubric are unclear )until I followed up with my TA), and he chose to take out participation and average the scores. Could have gotten an A+ but still happy.
great prof, interesting and accessible

Darryl is a very good professor. He explains concepts clearly, and is open to questions and suggestions. Very helpful for students who want to talk about their term papers or what not. Very engaging to listen to, and uses multi-media to illustrate concepts/liven up classes. There is a fair amount of work (1500 word paper, 3000-4000 word term paper and take-home), but it's doable. The class almost seems like a 200-level course.
Course was interesting, but not mandatory to attend, you can get by just fine without going to them. Darryl is a nice guy who knows his stuff.

Daryl is  smoke show. The only downside to this course was that I kept getting lost in Daryl's eyes..when I did manage to focus on the content- it was very obvious that Daryl is passionate about the subject. He was always clear, helpful and the way his outfits matched and fit him perfectly never ceased to amaze me.
He is awesome and handsome! The class is very structured and understandable. I can't believe SFU is cutting this course!

Cressman, in my opinion, is one of the best Communications profs at SFU. He is very interesting to listen to and is very knowledgeable in the content. The class itself is already an interesting class and I hope to have more classes with him down the road.
Great lectures. I've learned a lot about music history from this course. Darryl helped me to find some of the right sources for my essay.

I've been lucky enough to have Darryl as a prof a couple of times. He is one of the nicest profs I have ever had. He explains all the information and assignments thouroughly and clearly. He doesn't have a B.S ego, is knowledgable about the course content, and will never make you feel unwelcome. One of the best profs at SFU right now I think.
Darryl is an awesome prof! He makes this class very enjoyable. Definitely recommend!

Greatest prof I've ever had. I literally have never listened to prof before him. He explains things so clearly and makes the lecture really interesting. I always have full pages of notes. Excellent guy.

Darryl is an awesome instructor! He is always very helpful when it comes to papers. I had a hard time deciding what to write about and he helped me solidify my topic and gave me suggestions on where to look for sources. Oh and I should add he looks a LOT like Mr. Schuester from Glee. Funny since he's teach a class on popular music ;)
Best CMNS professor I've ever had. Always helpful to his students, eloquent speaker, highly engaged, makes the sometimes-long-and-complex readings easy to comprehend. Highly recommended!!
By far the best professor in the Communications department, was lucky to get him for 2 classes, lecutres are interesting, he is funny and extremely intelligent.

Don't let his good-natured goofiness fool you - he knows his stuff. His knowledge and intellectual depth are pretty impressive. One of the nicest instructors i've ever had. Plus, cute in that aw-shucks boy-next door way.
